Text: J.R. Smith had a game-high 32 points off the bench, helping the New York Knicks defeat the Boston Celtics 100-85 in a battle of two undermanned squads. Carmelo Anthony added 29 points and eight rebounds for the Knicks, who have now won five straight games, all coming without All-Star center Tyson Chandler (neck). Jeff Green had 19 points and 10 rebounds for the hosts in the setback, as Boston played without Kevin Garnett (ankle) and Courtney Lee (ankle) for the second straight game. It was Boston's fifth consecutive loss overall
